an5.53:4.1: “Mendicants, there are these five factors that support meditation.
an5.53:4.3: It’s when a mendicant has faith in the Realized One’s awakening:
an5.53:4.4: ‘That Blessed One is perfect, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, holy, knower of the world, supreme trainer of people, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, blessed.’
an5.53:4.5: They are rarely ill or unwell.
an5.53:4.6: Their stomach digests well, being neither too hot nor too cold, but just right, and fit for meditation.
an5.53:4.8: They reveal themselves honestly to the Teacher or sensible spiritual companions.
an5.53:4.9: They live with energy roused up for giving up unwholesome qualities and gaining wholesome qualities. They’re strong, firmly applied, not slacking off when it comes to developing wholesome qualities.
an5.53:4.10: They’re wise. They have the wisdom of arising and passing away which is noble, penetrative, and leads to the complete ending of suffering.
an5.53:4.11: These are the five factors that support meditation.”
